projects.title: DICED
projects.description: See emdata.janelia.org. I redesigned much of an existing React+AltJs app for the Janelia FlyEM team, adding a second build target to this open source app. This single page app queries a backend api called DICED to dynamically load EM image data. The code is available here.

projects.title: FlyEM Neuroglancer
projects.description: I added several customizations to a fork of the popular open source neuroimaging viewer Neuroglancer for the Janelia FlyEM team. For this project, I worked with vanilla WebGL and TypeScript. You can view the forked repository here.

projects.title: Django Projects
projects.description: I have worked on three closed-source Django applications. They are hosted on an internal network and closed-source, unfortunately. One of these project handled ordering stocks from an internal store. The other two were geared towards employee time tracking and billing. All were built with MySQL, Django, and jquery.

projects.title: Portfolio Site
projects.description: I built the site you are currently hanging out on! It's completely front-end, utilizing React, D3 and bootstrap. Take a look at the source code.

projects.title: ADHD/ASD Study Database
projects.description: I led a small team in the Fair Neuroimaging lab, building a Neo4j database for monitoring and visualizing study data. We built an object-oriented Python framework for importing data from many different sources into this database.

projects.title: HCP Exacloud
projects.description: I built a meta-pipeline for the Fair Neuroimaging lab launch and monitor the stages of the Human Connectome Pipeline on the Exacloud cluster, which previously needed a fair amount of human monitoring. My framework included built-in validation and notifications.

projects.title: Rubicon Atlas
projects.description: I worked for an educational software company building a large application called Atlas, which used PHP, javascript, and MSSQL. Later, I worked on a smaller app for this company using AngularJS. This work was closed-source.
